Package com.mathmaster13.fynotek

Class ModernFynotekWord

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mathmaster13.fynotek.FynotekWord
      • com.mathmaster13.fynotek.ModernFynotekWord
  • public class ModernFynotekWord
extends FynotekWord
    A class for handling words in Fynotek, a conlang by mochaspen. All objects created by this class are immutable. Fynotek documentarion can be found here.

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_MAGNITUDE

        public static final java.math.BigInteger MAX_MAGNITUDE
        The maximum integer supported by Fynotek's number system. You can compare if a number x is too large or small with (x.abs().compareTo(MAX_MAGNITUDE) > 0).
        See Also:
        number(BigInteger)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModernFynotekWord

        public ModernFynotekWord​(java.lang.String word,
                         boolean isProper)
        Converts a String and a boolean into a ModernFynotekWord. The String contains the word itself, while the boolean represents whether the word is a proper noun: true if it is, and false if it is not. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored (the String.trim() method is called on word).
        Parameters:
        word - word to be converted to a ModernFynotekWord.
        isProper - whether the word is a proper noun or not.

      • ModernFynotekWord

        public ModernFynotekWord​(java.lang.String word)
        Converts a String into a ModernFynotekWord. The word is assumed not to be a proper noun. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored (the String.trim() method is called on word).
        Parameters:
        word - word to be converted to a ModernFynotekWord.

    • Method Detail

      • ablaut

        protected ModernFynotekWord ablaut​(char vowel)
        Marks this FynotekWord with the specified ablaut. There is also a special case for the word "folo" if it is not a proper noun, since its ablaut is irregular.
        Specified by:
        ablaut in class FynotekWord
        Parameters:
        vowel - the ablaut to mark the word as.
        Returns:
        this FynotekWord marked with the specified ablaut.
        See Also:
        FynotekWord.markVowel

      • getNonHypoTense

        protected char getNonHypoTense​(char tense)
        Description copied from class: FynotekWord
        An internal-use method used in verbTense. It is not recommended to use this method when extending this class. As such, documentation will not be provided. When extending this class, one can simply make this method return '␀' or something similar.
        Specified by:
        getNonHypoTense in class FynotekWord

      • nounCase

        public ModernFynotekWord nounCase​(char caseOfNoun)
        Returns this ModernFynotekWord inflected for the noun case specified by caseOfNoun. caseOfNoun should be either 'n' (nominative), 'a' (accusative), 'g' (genitive), or 'd' (dative). All other charcters will cause the original object to be returned.
        Parameters:
        caseOfNoun - the noun case to inflect this ModernFynotekWord for.
        Returns:
        this ModernFynotekWord inflected for the specified noun case.
        See Also:
        match(FynotekWord)

      • suffix

        public ModernFynotekWord suffix​(java.lang.String suffix)
        Returns a ModernFynotekWord with the specified suffix appended to the end of this word. If the suffix creates a phonotactically invalid sequence, n or a will be infixed as needed to make the resulting word phonotactically valid. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored (the String.trim() method is called on suffix).
        Parameters:
        suffix - the suffix to be appended to the end of this ModernFynotekWord.
        Returns:
        a ModernFynotekWord with the specified suffix appended to the end of it.
        See Also:
        prefix(String)

      • prefix

        public ModernFynotekWord prefix​(java.lang.String prefix)
        Returns a ModernFynotekWord with the specified prefix appended to the beginning of this word. If the prefix creates a phonotactically invalid sequence, n or a will be infixed as needed to make the resulting word phonotactically valid. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored (the String.trim() method is called in the suffix method).
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix to be appended to the beginning of this ModernFynotekWord.
        Returns:
        a ModernFynotekWord with the specified prefix appended to the beginning of it.
        See Also:
        suffix(String)

      • isProper

        public boolean isProper()
        Returns whether this ModernFynotekWord is a proper noun or not. Specifically, this returns true if this word is a proper noun, and false if it is not.
        Returns:
        whether this ModernFynotekWord is a proper noun or not.
        See Also:
        ModernFynotekWord(String, boolean)

        public ModernFynotekWord personSuffix​(int person)
        Description copied from class: FynotekWord

        Specified by:
        personSuffix in class FynotekWord
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this FynotekWord with a suffix added to mark the first, second, or third person.
        See Also:

      • number

        public static java.lang.String number​(java.math.BigInteger num)
        Returns the Fynotek translation of the specified number. If the number's absolute value is greater than MAX_MAGNITUDE, an empty String is returned.
        Parameters:
        num - the number to be translated.
        Returns:
        the Fynotek translation of the specified number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the number provided is too large for the number system to handle.
        See Also:
        MAX_MAGNITUDE

      • number

        public static java.lang.String number​(long num)
        Returns the Fynotek translation of the specified number.
        Parameters:
        num - the number to be translated.
        Returns:
        the Fynotek translation of the specified number.

      • isValidSequence

        public static boolean isValidSequence​(java.lang.String sequence)
        Returns whether the given sequence is phonotactically and orthographically valid in Fynotek. Capitalization is ignored (for example, "A" and "a" are treated the same way). Multiple words can be separated by whitespace, and this function will only return true if all words in sequence are valid. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored (the String.trim() method is called on sequence). A sequence containing punctuation marks, numbers, or other non-letter characters returns false, as well as an empty sequence or one containing only whitespace.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence to be checked for validity.
        Returns:
        true if sequence is a valid sequence, and false if otherwise.
